verb.description: Make the sound of (a word or part of a word) in the correct or a particular way.
examples: a company whose name no one could pronounce

verb.description: Declare or announce, typically formally or solemnly.
examples: allow history to pronounce the verdict
she was pronounced dead at the scene
the doctors pronounced that he would never improve

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French pronuncier, from Latin pronuntiare, from pro- out, forth + nuntiare announce (from nuntius messenger).
